New Records: Pete Alonso became the first player in MLB history to hit a go-ahead home run with his team trailing in the ninth inning or later in a winner-take-all playoff game.
Key Match Events: Pete Alonso hit a three-run home run in the top of the ninth inning to secure a 4-2 victory for the New York Mets over the Milwaukee Brewers.
Jake Bauers and Sal Frelick hit back-to-back home runs in the bottom of the seventh inning for the Brewers.
David Peterson pitched the ninth inning for the Mets, giving up an opening single to Sal Frelick and striking out one before Brice Turang hit into a game-ending double play.
Post-Match Reflections: Pete Alonso expressed his happiness in contributing to the team's victory, stating, 'I'm just happy to come through for the boys.'
Alonso also reflected on the team's hard work throughout the year, saying, 'We've worked so hard all year to get to this point.'
